intro: Gomphostemma latifolium, commonly known as broadleaf gomphostemma, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Menispermaceae family, which includes climbing plants and shrubs. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and produces small, yellowish-green flowers. Its fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
